block.p: Virginia Wylie Davis, a daughter of Penelope and Wendell Davis Jr. of Larchmont, N.Y., was married there last evening to Christopher Bryan Hartung, a son of Mary and Peter Hartung Jr. of York, Pa. The Rev. Thomas E. Nicoll performed the ceremony at St. John's Episcopal Church.

Mrs. Hartung, 28, is known as Ginger. She manages the Adopt-a-Bench and Tree Trust programs for the Women's Committee at the Central Park Conservancy in New York. She is also a member of the Blue Hill Troupe, a Gilbert and Sullivan society. She graduated from St. Lawrence University. Her father, who is retired, was a partner in Scheuermann & Davis, which was a law firm in New York.

Virginia Wylie Davis, a daughter of Penelope and Wendell Davis Jr. of Larchmont, N.Y., was married there last evening to Christopher Bryan Hartung, a son of Mary and Peter Hartung Jr. of York, Pa. The Rev. Thomas E. Nicoll performed the ceremony at St. John's Episcopal Church.

Mrs. Hartung, 28, is known as Ginger. She manages the Adopt-a-Bench and Tree Trust programs for the Women's Committee at the Central Park Conservancy in New York. She is also a member of the Blue Hill Troupe, a Gilbert and Sullivan society. She graduated from St. Lawrence University. Her father, who is retired, was a partner in Scheuermann & Davis, which was a law firm in New York.

Mr. Hartung, 32, is an account representative in Vienna, Va., for Cable and Wireless, the British telecommunications company. He graduated from the University of Pittsburgh and received an M.B.A. degree from Duquesne University. His father is a computer programmer for McCrory Stores, a variety store chain based in York.
